lead_paragraph: Three brothers, ages 13, 16 and 17, were charged with first-degree murder on Thursday in the killings last month of two people at a homeless encampment in Seattle.

headline.print_headline: Washington: Brothers Charged in Murders at a Homeless Camp
headline.main: Washington: Brothers Charged in Murders at a Homeless Camp

snippet: Three brothers, ages 13, 16 and 17, were charged with first-degree murder on Thursday in the killings last month of two people at a homeless encampment in Seattle.
abstract: Seattle prosecutors charge James and Jerome Taafulisia and their 13-year-old brother, all homeless, with first-degree murder in killings of two people at homeless encampment; older brothers,  age 17 and 16 respectively, are charged as adults, while younger brother is charged as juvenile.
